general_advisory: Due to low pressure, a good amount of rainfall is expected in next 5 days. Farmers are advised to complete their transplanting activities. Prepare bundles to store rainwater. Make drainage channels for removal of excess water. Postpone the spraying of fertilizers and pesticides for next 4-5 days. Drain out excess water from the root zone.

advisory: Complete the transplanting process in paddy.
Make bunds to store rainwater in the field.
Take 18-21 days old seedlings for transplanting.
Monitor the field for blast diseases and stem rot.
For blast diseases, spray Hexaconazole 5% EC.
For stem rot, spray Carbendazim 50% WP.
Earthing up by the soil should be done after the application of Urea.
Make drainage channel and remove excess water from the root zone.
For turcicum leaf blight, spray Propiconazole 25% EC.
For fall army worm, spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG.
For aphids, spray Imidacloprid.
Remove excess water from the field.
Spray Imidacloprid to manage thrips and aphids.
Remove weeds and keep the field clean.
For Yellow vein mosaic virus, spray Imidacloprid 17.8 SL.
Remove excess water from the field.
Spray Imidacloprid to manage thrips and aphids.
Remove weeds and keep the field clean.
For Yellow vein mosaic virus, spray Imidacloprid 17.8 SL.
Keep the field clean.
To control Chilli thrips, spray Malathion or Imidachloprid 17.8 SL.
For leaf blight in Chilli, spray carbendazim or Mancozeb fungicides.
Drain out excess water from the field.
Apply Mancozeb or Thiram to manage Fusarium wilt.
For cercospora leaf spot, spray Copper oxychloride.
For Yellow vein mosaic virus, spray Quinalphos 25EC.
Avoid waterlogging to prevent rotting.
Examine the crop for any disease and pests.
For fruit and shoot borer, remove the affected terminal shoots.
For powdery mildew disease, spray Dinocap or Carbendazim.
Avoid waterlogging to prevent rotting.
Examine the crop for any disease and pests.
For fruit and shoot borer, remove the affected terminal shoots.
Keep the root zone weed free.
Spray Imidacloprid to manage Thrips, ants, and other sucking pests.
Spray Carbendazim or Mancozeb to control leaf blight.
For Gundhi bug infestation, spray Malathion.
In case of aphid infestation, spray Imidacloprid.
For beetles, fruit flies, and caterpillars, spray Malathion or Dimethoate.
For powdery mildew disease, spray Dinocap or Carbendazim.
